main event: Witnesses in Allentown, Pennsylvania observed a strange light in the sky on May 4, 1969.
interesting points: The sighting involved conflicting reports on the date and time, with one report stating May 4 at 10:30 PM and another suggesting May 6 at 6:37 PM., Witnesses described the object as appearing like revolving spheres and flat circular shapes in the air., The color of the object was noted as reddish amber, and it was compared to a falling star., The object reportedly moved fast, darting around and making noise., The sighting lasted approximately 3 seconds and involved at least one observer who was retired and alone.
sighted object: a strange light resembling a comet or a falling star
witness description: A 14-year-old boy who was interested in astronomy.
